accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical information, sketches, and sketchbooks and letters from Burbank to his wife, Covelle, regarding his travels in Italy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 55 sketches and two sketchbooks from Sicliy and Italy, 1959 and undated; letters and postcards, ca. 1958-1959, from Burbank who signed his letters "Petey", to his wife Covelle. Also included is a list of his paintings and their owners as of 1975, provided in a letter written by his widow.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm: reel 892 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Biographical information, one sketchbook of Italy and Sicily, 1959; 55 miscellaneous sketches; biographical information and a list of his paintings and their owners as of 1975, provided in a letter written by his widow filmed on reel 892.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Addison Burbank (1898-1961) was a painter and writer in New York, N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1975 and 2003 by Covelle Newcomb Burbank, widow of Addison Burbank. The 1975 material was filmed on reel 892.
